docs.snippet: PEABODY, Mass., July 2 -- Mrs. Mildred (Babe) Didrikson Zaharias moved a step closer today to her goal of recapturing the women's United States open golf championship.
docs.lead_paragraph: PEABODY, Mass., July 2 -- Mrs. Mildred (Babe) Didrikson Zaharias moved a step closer today to her goal of recapturing the women's United States open golf championship.

headline.main: Mrs. Zaharias Takes 7-Stroke Lead at Halfway Mark in U.S. Open Golf; FORMER CHAMPION CARDS 71 FOR 143 Mrs. Zaharias Sets a Course Mark in Pacing U. S. Open -- Betsy Rawls at 150

docs.snippet: ZURICH, Switzerland, July 3 (Reuters) -- Austria defeated Uruguay, 1950 world champion, 3 -- 1, at Hardtum Stadium today for an unexpected victory in a match to decide third and fourth places in the 1954 world football soccer tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: ZURICH, Switzerland, July 3 (Reuters) -- Austria defeated Uruguay, 1950 world champion, 3 -- 1, at Hardtum Stadium today for an unexpected victory in a match to decide third and fourth places in the 1954 world football soccer tournament.

docs.snippet: There have been few net changes in the news censorship business in the last six months. Small gains have been offset by losses.

headline.main: NEWS CENSORSHIP IS LITTLE CHANGED; World Survey Reveals Small Gains Offset by Losses -- Soviet Attitude Eased

docs.snippet: PEABODY, Mass., July 3 -- Mrs. Mildred (Babe) Didrikson Zaharias completed her comeback bid by winning the United States women's open golf championship today. Over the Salem Country Club course the famed woman all-around athlete, who underwent an...
docs.lead_paragraph: PEABODY, Mass., July 3 -- Mrs. Mildred (Babe) Didrikson Zaharias completed her comeback bid by winning the United States women's open golf championship today. Over the Salem Country Club course the famed woman all-around athlete, who underwent an operation for cancer in the spring of 1953, regained the title she held in 1948 and 1950 with a seventy-two-hole score of 291.

headline.main: Mrs. Zaharias Tallies 291 For Third Open Golf Title; MRS. ZAHARIAS' 291 TAKES GOLF TITLE

docs.snippet: THE Guatemalan crisis is an event of prime importance. It foreshadows for the first time Asiatic-type operations conducted by Communists in the New World. Also it brings up forcibly the neglected duties of the United States toward Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Guatemalan crisis is an event of prime importance. It foreshadows for the first time Asiatic-type operations conducted by Communists in the New World. Also it brings up forcibly the neglected duties of the United States toward Latin America.

headline.main: Communist Thunder to the South; The storm signals in Latin America are serious. Now our top job, says Mr. Berle, is to revitalize the hemisphere.

docs.snippet: There never would have been a need for alarm at Communist penetration in Latin America, and the present events in Guatemala would never have taken place, if Washington had not, the moment the war was over, turned its back on Latin America.

docs.snippet: GUATEMALA, July 9 -- Safe conduct assurances for Jacobo Arbenz Guzman, deposed President, his wife and two youngest children were asked today by Mexico.

docs.snippet: WITH twenty-one countries ready to discuss far - reaching highway problems, the sixth annual Pan-American Road Congress will open today in Caracas, Venezuela, continuing through July 21. Delegates seeking ways and means to improve motor...
docs.lead_paragraph: WITH twenty-one countries ready to discuss far - reaching highway problems, the sixth annual Pan-American Road Congress will open today in Caracas, Venezuela, continuing through July 21. Delegates seeking ways and means to improve motor transportation in South, Central and North America will consider projects that involve billions of dollars for vast highway development in mountains, plains and swamps.

headline.main: AUTOMOBILES: AGENDA; Caracas Meeting Will Take Up Road Building Throughout the Americas

docs.snippet: British sterling was given quite a fillip in value last Friday in response to the announcement of its use for sugar purchases through London. The plan envisages any non-dollar, non-sterling country can now buy dollar sugar in sterling or in any local...
docs.lead_paragraph: British sterling was given quite a fillip in value last Friday in response to the announcement of its use for sugar purchases through London. The plan envisages any non-dollar, non-sterling country can now buy dollar sugar in sterling or in any local currency acceptable to the Bank of England.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended July 9, 1954
